column4: As i said before, install the KDE environment. Do NOT remove Gnome, since the login window is a part of the Gnome environment.
If you remove GDM, you'll need to specify from TTY your login, and what environment to log into. Meaning, you'll pretty much be booting into a terminal.
gdm can be replaced too, with kdm (for frustrated)
it is a bit messy, but yes
